turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Hi, good morning!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Hello!

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Were you able to read a little about the charity Save the Children?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: No, I didn't see anything. I'm a little familiar with the charity though.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Oh, awesome! Well, in case you didn't know, Save the Children is a great charity that focuses on helping kids around the world. They use almost 90% of all donations directly to help children in the areas of education, safety and emergency...

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That's good to know that almost 90 percent of all donations go directly to help children. We know it's a problem not just in the United States.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes, exactly. I'm not a fan of charities that keep a lot of their proceeds for themselves. That's one reason I really like this one. Do you think you would be willing to make a small donation to Save the Children today?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I most likely will. I would like to read some more information, probably on their website, then donate from there. How do they help children in other parts of the world?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Well, I know that the research team for this task can take a portion of our payment and send it directly to the Save the Children. It's quick and easy, and even thought it may not seem like a lot of money, I think that every penny counts. I believe we can contribute any portion of our payment: $0 - 0.30.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That would be alright. Yes, I would like to donate at least one dollar to help Save the Children.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Oh great! I don't know if there is a maximum we can contribute, but regardless, I think your support would be really appreciated.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I've heard on the news that many children around the world are with their families trying to escape wars. I'm sure Save the Children helps them?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I believe so. In places like the middle east or southern Asia, even the smallest donation can go a long way.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes, I agree. It's difficult to watch the horrible things these children are going through. Our children and grandchildren are so blessed.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes, that's so true. I really wish more people could understand the importance of helping other, less fortunate then ourselves.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: So, Save the Children has somehow eliminated a high overhead cost. Good for them. I wish other charities would follow, especially local ones.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I believe they've been around for almost 100 years, so hopefully they have a pretty effecient organization. I completely understand that some expenses do occur in a non-profit, but with 90% going directly to the children, I feel pretty good about it.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Ok. I'm ready to donate, tell me how!

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Nice! I think we just have to wrap up our conversation, then the task organizers will automatically deduct our donations. Thanks again for supporting such a great cause! :)

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: No problem. I'm always about children. I agree, this is a good cause.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: It was great chatting with you. Have a great weekend! :)
